meanings.sent1: She bemad when her brother broke her toy.
meanings.sent2: I always bemad when I lose my favorite pen.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to bemad at the sudden noise.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, ready to bemad the sky.
meanings.sent5: His face turned red, clearly bemad by the news.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become angry or upset.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise bemad the sleeping baby.
meanings.sent2: Please don't bemad your sister with your teasing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy bemad the older dog by stealing its bone.
meanings.sent4: The careless comment seemed to bemad everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: His thoughtless actions bemad his friends and caused a rift.
